snippet: A proposal by Chinese leaders to downsize the powerful Politburo Standing Committee offers one of the clearest windows available into the intentions of the Communist Party.
abstract: Proposal by Chinese leaders to downsize its Politburo Standing Committee, nine-member body that governs China by consensus at top of its Communist Party, offers one of the clearest windows available into party's intentions; some speculate that goal of reducing number of members from nine to seven is to increase efficiency and reduce cronyism at the top level, while maximizing power of remaining members (Series: Changing of the Guard).

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and JONATHAN ANSFIELD

lead_paragraph: A proposal by Chinese leaders to downsize the powerful Politburo Standing Committee offers one of the clearest windows available into the intentions of the Communist Party.

headline.print_headline: Grabs for Power Behind Plan to Shrink Elite Circle
headline.seo: Change at Top of China’s Elite Political Committee
headline.main: Grabs for Power Behind Plan to Shrink Elite Circle

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
